title: Becky Sharp
brief_description: Adapted from a play that drew inspiration from William Makepeace Thackeray’s novel “Vanity Fair”, the film explores the English class system during the era of the Napoleonic Wars, but more importantly, is the first feature to use three-strip Technicolor.

constellations_other.name: Over the Technicolor rainbow
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores the beginning and legacy of Technicolor and was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Adam Virgona and Kristian Vass.

constellations_other.name: Evolution of colour
constellations_other.description: From stenciling film frames through to the survival of Technicolor after Hollywood stopped using it, this Constellation links early cinema to some of the world's greatest films.

description: Adapted from a play that drew inspiration from William Makepeace Thackeray’s book “Vanity Fair”, the film looks at the English class system during the era of the Napoleonic Wars. It is noted for being the first feature film to use the three-strip Technicolor process.
description_for_label: Adapted from a play that drew inspiration from William Makepeace Thackeray’s book “Vanity Fair”, the film looks at the English class system during the era of the Napoleonic Wars. It is noted for being the first feature film to use the three-strip Technicolor process.
